Signal drops and it feels you are streaming something with slow internet.2. When power cuts, it by default resets to maximum volume.3. Sound has distortion while playing at maximum volume.4. Aux cable is just 1 meter.5. Sound quality is better on BT than aux cable though it should be same.6. Remote doesn't work even at the distance of 4-5 meter. You need to go very close to the speaker.Should I buy this?Yes, if you have budget constraints and can't invest additional 2-3K. Buying this product at 3K is not a bad deal.Bottom line:Add 2K more in your budget and go for another product for better sound experience.

Review Content: Having used them for 2 years, I was fond of the Intex speakers till last month. But I was blown away with these Zebronics speakers. It's light weight and subtle in design, but the output is amazing. Imagine a bose drum speakers for car, now this gives the exact same effect. It's a steal at this price as it also has bluetooth. I am enjoying the songs on FM as I write this review.If there is a new version, I would like them to add a better display panel with more information. Also, I miss the manual bass/treble adjustments.

Review Content: For the Price this is a compact and clear audio device , there is not BASS adjustment , but its set just perfect, fit for small rooms , Bluetooth pair works well with iphone , one plus 3T , no complaints - have not tested the USB and SD , not sure if I will use it as BT works fine.Delivered on time without damage - as always with Amazon.For Small rooms and if not interested in  manipulation via equaliser - its worth the money.If you have small kids you should know that the speakers are all exposed partially , so if they push a pencil or pen on it , they will tear, so either keep it up on a shelf or avoid with Kids below 3-4 yrs
cleanedReviews: price compact clear audio device bass adjustment set perfect fit small room bluetooth pair work well iphone one plus complaint test usb sd sure use bt work fine.delivered time without damage always amazon.for small room interested manipulation via equaliser worth money.if small kid know expose partially push pencil pen tear either keep shelf avoid kid yrs

Review Content: Sound is good and base is more than I expected (not comparing with JBL or Creative though). Using it with my LED TV with HD STB and can experience a better feel than TV's inbuild audio system. it got a fair BT range, but sometimes it make some pairing issues (like device not showing or cannot pair) but rebooting solves it generally. Sound quality in better in BT, USB & SD card slot compared to FM or AUX i/p (that's obvious), initially sound didn't crack in the top volume which is quite high, but after almost 3months of use now i can feel bit cracking of sound in the higher range, that too negotiable. hope it wont increase it time. FM got an antenna that's a great feature but I am not getting a good FM reception may be due to the placement of the product. 1 problem I encountered was the defect in the 7segment display. A part of one of the 4 seven segment displays malfunctioned from the day 1 but I didn't want to change the entire product for this minor problem. Remote is a good option for these type of systems and its remote is good too even it got equalizer option for different genre. Another problem i feel that it does not remember its digital sound settings once its powered off and will start on the maximum possible sound output with respect to the analog sound knob's position. Overall if you are negotiable with these minor flaws and don't expect these 2000bucks speakers to be comparable with that of Bose then you can definitely enjoy action movies on HBO or Star Movies in HD or can enjoy your favorite music over BT/USB/SD. Overall value for money!
cleanedReviews: sound good base expect compare jbl creative though use led tv hd stb experience well feel tv's inbuild audio system get fair bt range sometimes make pair issue like device show cannot pair reboot solves generally sound quality well bt usb sd card slot compare fm aux i/p that's obvious initially sound crack top volume quite high almost use feel bit crack sound high range negotiable hope wont increase time fm get antenna that's great feature get good fm reception may due placement product problem encounter defect display part one seven segment display malfunction day want change entire product minor problem remote good option type system remote good even get equalizer option different genre another problem feel remember digital sound setting power start maximum possible sound output respect analog sound knob's position overall negotiable minor flaw expect comparable bose definitely enjoy action movie hbo star movie hd enjoy favorite music bt/usb/sd overall value money!

Review Content: Pros:- Absolutely awesome sound. Quite powerful bass. Set it up with my TV in the living room and it sounds almost like a Dolby surround theater.- Aesthetically pleasing. LED lights on the subwoofer is not overdone and would blend in very well in almost all scenarios.Cons:- Buttons on the unit are very plastic. Clicks loud and wobbles giving you a reminder of what you payed for it.- Remote is also low quality and you have to press hard to register.- FM antenna is super lame (A wire sticking out from the back). Picks up a lot of interference. Cannot leave it alongside other wires  on the back,  have to tie it upwards somewhere or leave it hanging out from the front to make it useful.- All the connection wires could have been a bit longer. Power cable being uncomfortably short.BUT WAIT!The cons may be more in number than the pros but the quality of sound blows it all off (Literally man the BASS!) . In the end speakers are for listening to your media and frankly this one out does many Sony or Phillips 5-10k systems. Just set it up properly and enjoy the music.Give it a thumbs up if it helped.Cheers mate.
cleanedReviews: pro absolutely awesome sound quite powerful bass set tv living room sound almost like dolby surround theater aesthetically please lead light subwoofer overdone would blend well almost scenarios.cons button unit plastic click loud wobble give reminder pay remote also low quality press hard register fm antenna super lame wire stick back pick lot interference cannot leave alongside wire back tie upwards somewhere leave hang front make useful connection wire could bit longer power cable uncomfortably short.but wait!the con may number pro quality sound blow literally man bass end listen medium frankly one many sony phillips system set properly enjoy music.give thumb helped.cheers mate.

Review Content: The zebronics 4.1 multimedia speaker is a wonderful choice. Iam using it for more than 3 months.If you are a normal user then it's a good deal. I bought this during the lighting deal during the sale and it's really worth for every penny paid.The Bluetooth features also works very well. However the cable which connects to the CPU is a bit short. Have to adjust accordingly.As I said if you are a normal user and wants a good sound quality it's an excellent choice. Else we have to go for 5.1 of a good brand.The customer support by zebronic was also good.Good delivery by Amazon too.
cleanedReviews: zebronics multimedia wonderful choice iam use months.if normal user good deal buy light deal sale really worth every penny paid.the bluetooth feature also work well however cable connects cpu bit short adjust accordingly.as say normal user want good sound quality excellent choice else go good brand.the customer support zebronic also good.good delivery too.

Review Content: Just bought this from Amazon. Packaging was fantastic. There was no chance that it could have damaged during the journey.Now, coming to the speakers. The quality is fantastic. Sound is crisp and clear. Review Content: It is an average product even though I wan't expecting much from it anyways at this price. Out of the box, the biggest annoyance is the extremely short wires for the satellite speakers. And every time you turn it off, the volume that you've set with the remote resets to max. There's no fabric or net covering for the diaphragms, so  you'll have to ensure that they're kept clean. There's no equalizer of any sort - the remote is just for volume, changing input source, and On/Standby.And like other users warned, after just a few weeks of use, the woofer has started hissing and popping even when it is on standby. As long as it gets electricity, it happens, and it rapidly becomes annoying. I can't return mine because I've already cut and spliced longer speaker wires.On the plus side, it is decently loud for a small apartment and even gives some sort of a surround sound vibe. I haven't used any other input methods other than PC, but others should appreciate the Bluetooth and USB/SD Card inputs

Review Content: Update:Stopped working suddenly without any reason. It has been not even a year.This has been one of my best purchases on Amazon. I am just in love with this product. Now, don't get me wrong, it might not compete with the likes of Sony in terms of sound quality, but for the money that you pay, you get a very balanced sound output. The bass is not great but decent, not overpowering. The overall sound signature is decent and it is great for normal day-to-day usage. If you are want something which is value for money, this is the one for you. I have been using it for over 5 months and it has never left me unimpressed.Now, the best part of it - the Bluetooth connectivity. I have used Philips Bluetooth speakers before and it was a pain connecting it as the connectivity always kept losing. With this product, the range is extremely good. I have never faced any lag or connectivity issue even a single time yet. Not only this, even if you are out of the line of sight, it works without any issue until you are within 15m range. I have played songs while being inside my bathroom ;) in my room and the speaker being in the hall of a one bhk flat and it worked flawlessly every single time.Amazon delivery was also great and the product was delivered in a good condition.Conclusion - If you want a good wireless speaker with a balanced sound output on a tight budget, go for it. It has all the basics correct, Bluetooth connectivity being an important one.

Review Content: I am very curious mind person because of my profession..this product is very good in all aspect..Proc-1) All features- Bluetooth, remote, Display2)Reasonable price3) Descent bass (No bass control button but automatically adjust bass)4)Awesome look..Color light in woofer looks good and change after some time (Not based on music)5) Very loud and clear sound (Not tested for 100% volume since very very loud..).Cons1) No bass control-(No bass control button but automatically adjust bass)- I can able to adjust bass trough mobile equalizer but natural bass of system is very good..Bass lovers can change as per their requirement..2) Wire length of speakers is not sufficient but anyway for any system we need to buy extra wire to position the speakers in room.I was confused with F&D F1500U 5.1 Due to brand but i checked the speaker output and found this speaker is having higher output..Normally woofer should be of high rated watt...F&D F1500U 5.1 don't provide bluetooth which is deal breaker for me..If you don't have concern of bluetooth connectivity then F&D F1500U 5.1 is good alternate for this speaker..Finally i recommend this..

Review Content: Awesome sound quality.Really very satisfied with product
V. Good sound

Zebronics is a rising manufacturer in computer accessories.I purchased these speakers about 1.5 years ago from Snapdeal. Without mentioning anything about the packaging and stuff, I'll begin the review.INSIDE THE BOX :Some manuals and cards were provided. 4 satellite speakers were on top of the sub-woofer. A 3.5mm-to-RCA (Stereo) cable of approx. 4ft was provided. A remote control that runs on 2 AAA batteries was provided.BUILD QUALITY and LOOKS :The satellite speakers and the sub-woofer are all made of wood and are very light weight.The sub-woofer has a volume control knob on the front which is accompanied by 4 push buttons named as Input, Play, Prev and Next (in order, from left to right). A small led display is provided on the front to display the input mode/track name/radio channel. The front side of the sub-woofer has a light changing LED to illuminate the speaker. On the right side of it, there is a SD CARD slot, a USB port and an air hole.The left side has pretty much nothing. On the back, there are 6 RCA female ports. 2 on the top are for input while the remaining 4 are for output. An FM antenna, a wire basically that acquires the FM signal is given on back. The power cable and a switch has been provided on the back.All the cables, that include the power cable, satellite speaker cables, provided aux cable are pretty short in length all of approximately the same length of around 4ft. It is very hectic to decide how to place the speakers because of such short length.AUDIO QUALITY and FUNCTIONING :The Zebronics BT4440RUCF can go pretty loud easily. The Highs and the Mids sound perfect, but the Lows are somewhat weak. Bass on this one is decent but not that good, the speakers must be arranged in a unique manner to achieve quality bass. However, the uniqueness is different in each case. For me, the bass sounds awesome when the sub-woofer is kept under my bed. But if kept under my desk, which it sounds very dull because all the bass spreads out and doesn‚Äôt really create an effect. If kept on top of the desk, the bass is decent but not very good.With the Bluetooth mode enabled, nothing really changes, but it might sound different due to equalizer settings on your phone. You need to be in the same room and in a range of 12ft. Walls may obstruct connectivity.The FM Radio also sounds equivalent if the signals are good. To get better signals, simply take the antenna wire and keep it a little higher from the ground.In the USB mode and the SD card mode, as soon as you insert the respective device, the speakers detect it and play the first song on the device. Only these 2 modes have an option of changing in-build equalizer mode using the remote control.The overall sound quality of the speakers is awesome.The remote control has various buttons, 20 to be exact. These include the stand-by button, input changer, mute/unmute, prev/fm-, play/pause, next/fm+, 0-9, 100+, eq and volume + & -.I wouldn‚Äôt put efforts on explaining the function of each and every button.PROS :1. Cheap2. Light weight3. Bluetooth connectivity4. Multimedia Support5. Good LookingCONS :1. Bass isn‚Äôt that great2. Bluetooth connectivity has low range3. Can‚Äôt adjust bass and treble individually4. Short length wires5. Stereo input instead of Quadrophonic inputVERDICT :4.1 Speakers that support Multimedia and have option for Bluetooth connectivity at such a low price is always a good deal. The short length of wires can be overcome by using extensions. The sound quality isn‚Äôt very rich but good at this price tag considering all other features. People looking for 4.1 speakers for day to day usage can go for these. But those who are looking for high quality speakers for music production and other such things should totally avoid these speakers.

Review Content: It is an okay 4.1 system.Cons:-1. All speakers wires are of the same length. That means you have to place all the 4 speakers near the woofer. The wires length is approximately 2 feet.2. Bass is not that deep. But OK for the price.3. Remote has the equalizer button but it just does not work. I think they probably give a common remote with some of these kind of speakers and this specific model does not support the equalizer feature.4. The supplied remote does not have the batteries. You'll have to buy them.Pros:-1. It has all the required features i. e. Aux, buetooth, memory card, pen drive and FM.Also, the Aux cable can be found in the box.2. The FM and the bluetooth features work fine.3. The sound quality is acceptable. Total RMS is 60 W. Subwoofer is of 20 W and the satalite speakers are of 10 W each.4. Max volume goes upto 30 and the sound is decent for a 10√ó12 room.

Review Content: It is an average product even though I wan't expecting much from it anyways at this price. Out of the box, the biggest annoyance is the extremely short wires for the satellite speakers. And every time you turn it off, the volume that you've set with the remote resets to max. There's no fabric or net covering for the diaphragms, so  you'll have to ensure that they're kept clean. There's no equalizer of any sort - the remote is just for volume, changing input source, and On/Standby.And like other users warned, after just a few weeks of use, the woofer has started hissing and popping even when it is on standby. As long as it gets electricity, it happens, and it rapidly becomes annoying. I can't return mine because I've already cut and spliced longer speaker wires.On the plus side, it is decently loud for a small apartment and even gives some sort of a surround sound vibe. I haven't used any other input methods other than PC, but others should appreciate the Bluetooth and USB/SD Card inputs

Review Content: Update:Stopped working suddenly without any reason. It has been not even a year.This has been one of my best purchases on Amazon. I am just in love with this product. Now, don't get me wrong, it might not compete with the likes of Sony in terms of sound quality, but for the money that you pay, you get a very balanced sound output. The bass is not great but decent, not overpowering. The overall sound signature is decent and it is great for normal day-to-day usage. If you are want something which is value for money, this is the one for you. I have been using it for over 5 months and it has never left me unimpressed.Now, the best part of it - the Bluetooth connectivity. I have used Philips Bluetooth speakers before and it was a pain connecting it as the connectivity always kept losing. With this product, the range is extremely good. I have never faced any lag or connectivity issue even a single time yet. Not only this, even if you are out of the line of sight, it works without any issue until you are within 15m range. I have played songs while being inside my bathroom ;) in my room and the speaker being in the hall of a one bhk flat and it worked flawlessly every single time.Amazon delivery was also great and the product was delivered in a good condition.Conclusion - If you want a good wireless speaker with a balanced sound output on a tight budget, go for it. It has all the basics correct, Bluetooth connectivity being an important one.

Review Content: Awesome sound quality.Really very satisfied with product
V. Good sound

Zebronics is a rising manufacturer in computer accessories.I purchased these speakers about 1.5 years ago from Snapdeal. Without mentioning anything about the packaging and stuff, I'll begin the review.INSIDE THE BOX :Some manuals and cards were provided. 4 satellite speakers were on top of the sub-woofer. A 3.5mm-to-RCA (Stereo) cable of approx. 4ft was provided. A remote control that runs on 2 AAA batteries was provided.BUILD QUALITY and LOOKS :The satellite speakers and the sub-woofer are all made of wood and are very light weight.The sub-woofer has a volume control knob on the front which is accompanied by 4 push buttons named as Input, Play, Prev and Next (in order, from left to right). A small led display is provided on the front to display the input mode/track name/radio channel. The front side of the sub-woofer has a light changing LED to illuminate the speaker. On the right side of it, there is a SD CARD slot, a USB port and an air hole.The left side has pretty much nothing. On the back, there are 6 RCA female ports. 2 on the top are for input while the remaining 4 are for output. An FM antenna, a wire basically that acquires the FM signal is given on back. The power cable and a switch has been provided on the back.All the cables, that include the power cable, satellite speaker cables, provided aux cable are pretty short in length all of approximately the same length of around 4ft. It is very hectic to decide how to place the speakers because of such short length.AUDIO QUALITY and FUNCTIONING :The Zebronics BT4440RUCF can go pretty loud easily. The Highs and the Mids sound perfect, but the Lows are somewhat weak. Bass on this one is decent but not that good, the speakers must be arranged in a unique manner to achieve quality bass. However, the uniqueness is different in each case. For me, the bass sounds awesome when the sub-woofer is kept under my bed. But if kept under my desk, which it sounds very dull because all the bass spreads out and doesn‚Äôt really create an effect. If kept on top of the desk, the bass is decent but not very good.With the Bluetooth mode enabled, nothing really changes, but it might sound different due to equalizer settings on your phone. You need to be in the same room and in a range of 12ft. Walls may obstruct connectivity.The FM Radio also sounds equivalent if the signals are good. To get better signals, simply take the antenna wire and keep it a little higher from the ground.In the USB mode and the SD card mode, as soon as you insert the respective device, the speakers detect it and play the first song on the device. Only these 2 modes have an option of changing in-build equalizer mode using the remote control.The overall sound quality of the speakers is awesome.The remote control has various buttons, 20 to be exact. These include the stand-by button, input changer, mute/unmute, prev/fm-, play/pause, next/fm+, 0-9, 100+, eq and volume + & -.I wouldn‚Äôt put efforts on explaining the function of each and every button.PROS :1. Cheap2. Light weight3. Bluetooth connectivity4. Multimedia Support5. Good LookingCONS :1. Bass isn‚Äôt that great2. Bluetooth connectivity has low range3. Can‚Äôt adjust bass and treble individually4. Short length wires5. Stereo input instead of Quadrophonic inputVERDICT :4.1 Speakers that support Multimedia and have option for Bluetooth connectivity at such a low price is always a good deal. The short length of wires can be overcome by using extensions. The sound quality isn‚Äôt very rich but good at this price tag considering all other features. People looking for 4.1 speakers for day to day usage can go for these. But those who are looking for high quality speakers for music production and other such things should totally avoid these speakers.

sub-woofer stereo cable approx provide remote control run aaa battery provided.build quality look satellite sub-woofer make wood light weight.the sub-woofer volume control knob front accompany push button name input play prev next order leave right small lead display provide front display input mode/track name/radio channel front side sub-woofer light change lead illuminate right side sd card Review Content: It is an average product even though I wan't expecting much from it anyways at this price. Out of the box, the biggest annoyance is the extremely short wires for the satellite speakers. And every time you turn it off, the volume that you've set with the remote resets to max. There's no fabric or net covering for the diaphragms, so  you'll have to ensure that they're kept clean. There's no equalizer of any sort - the remote is just for volume, changing input source, and On/Standby.And like other users warned, after just a few weeks of use, the woofer has started hissing and popping even when it is on standby. As long as it gets electricity, it happens, and it rapidly becomes annoying. I can't return mine because I've already cut and spliced longer speaker wires.On the plus side, it is decently loud for a small apartment and even gives some sort of a surround sound vibe. I haven't used any other input methods other than PC, but others should appreciate the Bluetooth and USB/SD Card inputs
cleanedReviews: average product even though wan't expect much anyways price box big annoyance extremely short wire satellite every time turn volume set remote reset max there's fabric net cover diaphragms ensure they're kept clean there's equalizer sort remote volume change input source on/standby.and like user warn week use woofer start hiss pop even standby long get electricity happen rapidly becomes annoy can't return mine i've already cut splice longer wires.on plus side decently loud small apartment even give sort surround sound vibe use input method pc others appreciate bluetooth usb/sd card inputs

Review Content: Update:Stopped working suddenly without any reason. It has been not even a year.This has been one of my best purchases on Amazon. I am just in love with this product. Now, don't get me wrong, it might not compete with the likes of Sony in terms of sound quality, but for the money that you pay, you get a very balanced sound output. The bass is not great but decent, not overpowering. The overall sound signature is decent and it is great for normal day-to-day usage. If you are want something which is value for money, this is the one for you. I have been using it for over 5 months and it has never left me unimpressed.Now, the best part of it - the Bluetooth connectivity. I have used Philips Bluetooth speakers before and it was a pain connecting it as the connectivity always kept losing. With this product, the range is extremely good. I have never faced any lag or connectivity issue even a single time yet. Not only this, even if you are out of the line of sight, it works without any issue until you are within 15m range. I have played songs while being inside my bathroom ;) in my room and the speaker being in the hall of a one bhk flat and it worked flawlessly every single time.Amazon delivery was also great and the product was delivered in a good condition.Conclusion - If you want a good wireless speaker with a balanced sound output on a tight budget, go for it. It has all the basics correct, Bluetooth connectivity being an important one.

Review Content: I am using this product for 20 days now...why I thought I will give one star but I will give 2 Bcs of sound quality Bcs quality of sound is good.Pros:Sound is goodGood build qualityLooks nice.Cons1. Mostly all functions of the remote dont function properly.volume through remote doesn't go beyond 30 and volume on 30 is sounds less. Or may be remote is damaged I am not sure because when I use speaker volume manually it does not show any number. Also while using remote from minus button volume increase and sometimes it changes the input also.2. Red input doesnt function properly so surround speaker volume is very very low. I even tried it with Dolby surround test music and I really had to press my ears with speakers to hear the sound.3. The aux cable is too small.4. Amazon gives just 10 days return on this.5. The red tweets on the small speaker is a show piece and hence misleading.6. Remote has eq button but that doesn't do anything.7. Range of the remote is too less not even two meters and quality of the remote is cheap and local.Overall I bought this because I wanted to use sitting on my bed...which now is not possible as remote does not function properly.

Review Content: I am very curious mind person because of my profession..this product is very good in all aspect..Proc-1) All features- Bluetooth, remote, Display2)Reasonable price3) Descent bass (No bass control button but automatically adjust bass)4)Awesome look..Color light in woofer looks good and change after some time (Not based on music)5) Very loud and clear sound (Not tested for 100% volume since very very loud..).Cons1) No bass control-(No bass control button but automatically adjust bass)- I can able to adjust bass trough mobile equalizer but natural bass of system is very good..Bass lovers can change as per their requirement..2) Wire length of speakers is not sufficient but anyway for any system we need to buy extra wire to position the speakers in room.I was confused with F&D F1500U 5.1 Due to brand but i checked the speaker output and found this speaker is having higher output..Normally woofer should be of high rated watt...F&D F1500U 5.1 don't provide bluetooth which is deal breaker for me..If you don't have concern of bluetooth connectivity then F&D F1500U 5.1 is good alternate for this speaker..Finally i recommend this..
cleanedReviews: curious mind person profession..this product good feature bluetooth remote descent bass bass control button automatically adjust look..color light woofer look good change time base loud clear sound test volume since bass control-(no bass control button automatically adjust bass able adjust bass trough mobile equalizer natural bass system good..bass lover change per wire length sufficient anyway system need buy extra wire position room.i confused f&d due brand check output find higher output..normally woofer high rat watt...f&d provide bluetooth deal breaker me..if concern bluetooth connectivity f&d good alternate speaker..finally recommend this..

The Bluetooth, Radio, SD Card and Pendrive slots work well. Pen drive being the most effective.Cons:-1. There is no bass control which sucks.2. The songs with high bass produce a hissing type of noise which comes from the woofer(and it's damn irritating) for which I wanted to return these speakers but these Amazon people only exchange and no return policy is there.3. The wires provided for the satellite speakers are very short in length so it's very difficult to place the speakers.

Review Content: Awesome sound quality.Really very satisfied with product
V. Good sound

Zebronics is a rising manufacturer in computer accessories.I purchased these speakers about 1.5 years ago from Snapdeal. Without mentioning anything about the packaging and stuff, I'll begin the review.INSIDE THE BOX :Some manuals and cards were provided. 4 satellite speakers were on top of the sub-woofer. A 3.5mm-to-RCA (Stereo) cable of approx. 4ft was provided. A remote control that runs on 2 AAA batteries was provided.BUILD QUALITY and LOOKS :The satellite speakers and the sub-woofer are all made of wood and are very light weight.The sub-woofer has a volume control knob on the front which is accompanied by 4 push buttons named as Input, Play, Prev and Next (in order, from left to right). A small led display is provided on the front to display the input mode/track name/radio channel. The front side of the sub-woofer has a light changing LED to illuminate the speaker. On the right side of it, there is a SD CARD slot, a USB port and an air hole.The left side has pretty much nothing. On the back, there are 6 RCA female ports. 2 on the top are for input while the remaining 4 are for output. An FM antenna, a wire basically that acquires the FM signal is given on back. The power cable and a switch has been provided on the back.All the cables, that include the power cable, satellite speaker cables, provided aux cable are pretty short in length all of approximately the same length of around 4ft. It is very hectic to decide how to place the speakers because of such short length.AUDIO QUALITY and FUNCTIONING :The Zebronics BT4440RUCF can go pretty loud easily. The Highs and the Mids sound perfect, but the Lows are somewhat weak. Bass on this one is decent but not that good, the speakers must be arranged in a unique manner to achieve quality bass. However, the uniqueness is different in each case. For me, the bass sounds awesome when the sub-woofer is kept under my bed. But if kept under my desk, which it sounds very dull because all the bass spreads out and doesn‚Äôt really create an effect. If kept on top of the desk, the bass is decent but not very good.With the Bluetooth mode enabled, nothing really changes, but it might sound different due to equalizer settings on your phone. You need to be in the same room and in a range of 12ft. Walls may obstruct connectivity.The FM Radio also sounds equivalent if the signals are good. To get better signals, simply take the antenna wire and keep it a little higher from the ground.In the USB mode and the SD card mode, as soon as you insert the respective device, the speakers detect it and play the first song on the device. Only these 2 modes have an option of changing in-build equalizer mode using the remote control.The overall sound quality of the speakers is awesome.The remote control has various buttons, 20 to be exact. These include the stand-by button, input changer, mute/unmute, prev/fm-, play/pause, next/fm+, 0-9, 100+, eq and volume + & -.I wouldn‚Äôt put efforts on explaining the function of each and every button.PROS :1. Cheap2. Light weight3. Bluetooth connectivity4. Multimedia Support5. Good LookingCONS :1. Bass isn‚Äôt that great2. Bluetooth connectivity has low range3. Can‚Äôt adjust bass and treble individually4. Short length wires5. Stereo input instead of Quadrophonic inputVERDICT :4.1 Speakers that support Multimedia and have option for Bluetooth connectivity at such a low price is always a good deal. The short length of wires can be overcome by using extensions. The sound quality isn‚Äôt very rich but good at this price tag considering all other features. People looking for 4.1 speakers for day to day usage can go for these. But those who are looking for high quality speakers for music production and other such things should totally avoid these speakers.
